The arraignment of unbelief, as the grand cause of our nationall non-establishment: cleared in a sermon to the Honourable House of Commons in Parliament, at Margarets Westminster, upon the 28th. of May, 1645. being the day of their publike fast. / By Joseph Caryl, late preacher to the Honourable Society of Lincolnes-Inne, now pastor at Magnus neer the bridge, London. Caryl, Joseph, 1602-1673. England and Wales. Parliament.
[4], 48 p.
Printed by G. Miller for Giles Calvert, at the Black-spread-Eagle at the west end of Pauls, London, : M.DC.XLV. [1645]
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
